Dear Dave and Group,

I'm trying to use the "size" attribute of a species t=
o specify the
number of sites that a surface-bound species occupies (n_k in=
 eqn. 3.4
of the "Defining Phases and Intefaces"). I get an error from ct2c=
tml
when I try to include this keyword. The ct2ctml.log file reads...

Trac=
eback (most recent call last):
  ...
  File "./Si3N4.cti", line 73, in ?
  =
  note =3D "J 3/67"
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argumen=
t 'size'

This species is declared like this in my cti file...

species(nam=
e =3D "SIF3NH2(S)",
    atoms =3D " N:1  H:2  Si:1  F:3 ",
    size =3D 2,
=
    thermo =3D (
       NASA( [  300.00,  1000.00], [ 8.419753800E-001,  8.=
371041600E-003, 
              -1.307703000E-005,  9.759360300E-009, -2.727=
938000E-012,
              -5.248628800E+002, -4.527267800E+000] ),
       =
NASA( [ 1000.00,  1685.00], [ 2.475398900E+000,  8.811218700E-004, 
       =
       -2.093948100E-007,  4.275718700E-012,  1.600656400E-014,
           =
   -8.125562000E+002, -1.218874700E+001] )
             ),
    note =3D "J =
3/67"
       )

Any ideas on where I might be going wrong? Thanks very much=
.

Best,

Paul
